symposium.model

Class TimeFormat

  • java.lang.Object
    • symposium.model.TimeFormat

  • public final class TimeFormat
extends java.lang.Object
    TimeFormat is a utility class for operations about the formating of time.

    Definitions:

    AbsoluteTime:
        an int that donates minute count from midnight of day 0. int is more than enough to donate minutes, it gives us about 4000 years.

    NormalTime:
        a string of the format "<number of day>, <hr>:<mnt>-<hr>:<mnt>" or multiple lines of the same format. hr is in 24 hour format and days starts with day 0 normal time does not have to be simple (see TimeRangeSeries.isSimple()), it will be simplified if necessary.
    Regex for valid normalTime "^(?: *\d+ *, *\d+:\d+-\d+:\d+ *)(?:\n+ *\d+ *, *\d+:\d+-\d+:\d+ *)*\s*$"

    • Method Detail

      • getDayRange

        public static TimeRange getDayRange(int dayNumber)
        getDayRange create a range including exactly every point in a day
        Parameters:
        dayNumber - The number of the day for which the range wanted.
        Returns:
        TimeRange; with the first minute of dayNumber as the start, and last minute of dayNumber as the end.

      • absoluteToNormal

        public static java.lang.String absoluteToNormal(Range absoluteRange)
        absoluteToNormal convert absoluteRange to normalRange.
        Parameters:
        absoluteRange - is the Range to be converted to normal time format.
        Returns:
        String; of the NormalTime format.

      • normalToAbsolute

        public static Range normalToAbsolute(java.lang.String normalRange)
        normalToAbsolute convert normalTime format to absoluteTime format.
        Parameters:
        normalRange - is a range in a normalTime format.
        Returns:
        Range; with absoluteTime format.

      • timeComponentsToAbsolute

        public static int timeComponentsToAbsolute(int day,
                                           int hours,
                                           int minutes)
        timeComponentsToAbsolute convert separate day, hour, minute to one absolute time.
        Parameters:
        day - The day time
        hours - The hour of the day
        minutes - The minutes of the day
        Returns:
        int; in absoluteTime format.

      • getNumberOfDay

        public static int getNumberOfDay(int timePoint)
        getNumberOfDay given a time point it returns the number of day that time point is included in.
        Parameters:
        timePoint - a point in time by absolute minutes.
        Returns:
        int; the number of day that the given point lies inside.

      • absoluteTimeToClockString

        private static java.lang.String absoluteTimeToClockString(int absoluteTime)

      • withinError

        public static boolean withinError(int origin,
                                  int compare,
                                  int error)
        withinError given two absoluteTime's it checks if one is within a given error.
        Parameters:
        origin - the first absoluteTime.
        compare - the second absoluteTime.
        error - the acceptable error range.
        Returns:
        boolean; true if the absolute value of (origin-compare) >= error.
